abstracts.cdata!:
The audit ratings concur by and large,
            with those by the Implementation Completion report (ICR),
            namely, satisfactory project outcome, substantial
            institutional development impacts, and satisfactory
            performance by the Borrower. Nonetheless, it downgrades
            sustainability to likely, though upgrades the Bank
            performance to highly satisfactory. Lessons are addressed as
            follows. Given that rehabilitation is only a partial
            solution for most irrigation projects (i.e., symptom of
            inadequate management and insufficient maintenance funding),
            this experience clearly demonstrates that rehabilitation
            should be supplemented by measures to foster creation of
            efficient institutions, with the ability, inter alia, to
            measure and manage water, and cost operation and maintenance
            accurately. Most effective investments leading to higher
            levels of efficiency in irrigation projects, are the
            installation of a large number of water, and electricity
            flow measuring devices, to be agreed - in consultation with
            stakeholders - on operating rules. It is critical that
            adequate attention be given during appraisal to investments
            linking agricultural technology with the measures to improve
            production, and marketing of outputs, to avoid jeopardizing
            the ability of project beneficiaries to cover operation, and
            maintenance costs. Social assessments are needed,
            particularly given high levels of rural poverty, to help
            ensure that infrastructure investments take into account the
            beneficiaries' ownership, and their ability to
            contribute towards maintenance of new facilities. In the
            project, such an approach could have created
            smallholders' cooperatives, or micro-credit groups,
            that could have moved landowners beyond subsistence agriculture.
